1.content:
Name Ash Ketchum
Age: 17
Complexion: Olive tan
Hair: Tousled dark brown
Height: 5'8
Weight: 11 stone ---- 154 lbs
Body type: Average to chubby
Description: Ash Ketchum is a stubborn, yet enthusiastic pokemon trainer, at 17 he is a year younger than the average entrant into the Pokemon Leauge. Among those setting off at the same time as Ash on his Pokemon Journey is his neighbour and close friend Gary, of whom he shares a love hate relationship. On account lazyness, and his love of fast food and candy, Ash had been fairly chubby since his early teens, and despite his mother's frequent attempts to cut down on his junk food diet.
Image http://tinyurl.com/y93ta4b

Name Gary Oak
Age: 18
Complexion: Fair, tanned.
Hair: Mousy brown
Height: 5'10
Weight: 9 stone 13 lbs ---- 138 lbs
Body type: Slim, toned
Description: Gary Oak is the grandson of Kanto Pokemon Professor Oak. He prides himself on his knowledge of Pokemon, and their strengths and weaknesses. He shares an intense rivalry with his friend and neighbour, Ash Ketchum who has been entered the Pokemon League also. Unlike Ash, Gary has a calm and patient personality, and fit and reasonably toned due to his frequent exercise regime.
Image http://tinyurl.com/5whplxe

Name Ethan Gold
Age: 18
Complexion: Pale
Hair: Blue
Height: 5'11
Weight: 8 stone 10 lbs ---- 122 lbs
Body type: Skinny
Description: Ethan Gold is a thin, quite and somewhat shy young pokemon trainer who after years of waiting has finally been accepted into started the Pokemon Leauge. Despite being quiate, Ethan is kind and helpful to others, as well as extremely quick thinking in an emergency.
Image http://tinyurl.com/bzelsd2

Name Barry Palmer
Age: 19
Complexion: Pale
Hair: Curly blonde
Height: 5'10
Weight: 9 stone 2 lbs ---- 128
Body type: Slender
Description: Barry Palmer is an exuberant pokemon trainer from Hoen, starting his pokemon journey with his best friend Lucas, though not extremely tallented with pokemon he cares for them immensely, and always wants to try new things, often at great spead (to Lucas's dismay).
Image http://tinyurl.com/b47wjw2
1.title: Which trainer?

choices: Rushed across time to meet Oak...
Found Gary trying to wake him...
Arrived at Gary's an hour early...
11.content:
Today was the day that Ash started his Pokemon Journey, he was fortunate that the League had granted him entry this year considering on paper he was below the recommended age group, though infact he was only a few months off his eighteenth birthday. He'd arranged to meet Gary in the morning, so that they could both go and collect their first Pokemon together. He had had dreams about what his first Pokemon might be, what he'd like - what he'd get, either way it didn't matter to Ash. A Pokemon was a Pokemon, and he'd love it whatever it was. Gary maintained that his choice would be more considered and less brash and needy, but that's Gary all over. Ash knew that his arrogance was just bravado, and that he'd likely be happy with whatever he gets, even if he didn't get a choice.

It was too bad that Ash's mum couldn't be there to see him off, but she promised she'd meet him in Vermilion City when he passes through. She's made sure he was packed, that he had money, plenty of food, clean underwear and a mobile phone for calling home.

Throughout the night Ash tossed and turned, unable to sleep as his body was still alive with excitement and anticipation. Fortunately he wasn't meeting Gary at the crack of dawn, with a bit of luck he wouldn't be too efficient and turn up on time, or early even. For all his excitement Ash knew that he needed, and wanted, a good nights sleep, he couldn't see himself arriving to collect his first ever pokemon while half asleep, nor did he want to.

The next morning Ash...
11.title: Ash Katchem

choices: Ash grabs a snack before leaving.
Finally Ash and Gary set off (half an hour after they were suppose to arrive).
112.content:
Ash hadn't been able to get to sleep until nearly 5:30 AM, the number of Pokemon related plans he'd made as he'd laid there awake, too excited to sleep, were impressive even by his standards, it was a shame that the tiredness and the eventual sleep had quickly made him forget most of them. Ash awoke many hours later to see Gary's face staring down at him, by the tone of his voice he had been shaking Ash trying to wake him up for some time.

"Gary?.... what time is it." Ash groaned.

"It's five-to-nine Ash, we were suppose to meet at the park at half-eight so cycle over to Grandpa's for 10" Gary insisted in an unusually impatient manner.

"We've got plenty of time" Ash exclaimed, turning over to face away from the window, "it'll only take us twenty minutes to bike over there"

Ash's stubbornness could be a touch irritating sometimes, but Gary didn't let it bother him, he instead simply tugged at Ash's duvet neatly drawing it back so's only Ash's feet were still covered, Ash who was dressed only in boxers scrambled to pull it back over himself,

"Come on Ash, it'll take at least half an hour for you to get ready, sooner you start, the sooner we can go" Gary said, trying to sound reasonable.

Ash who had seemingly drifted back to sleep failed to take any notice, or at least he didn't respond. This time Gary was less tidy, he grabbed the duvet and pulled it off the bed entirely, dropping it to the floor. By the Ash's brief movement followed by a return to an 'apparent' sleeping state it was clear to Gary that Ash was either pretending, or just trying to go back to sleep while simultaneously winning a petty argument with him. Normally Gary wouldn't rise to it, and would find a more subtle way to win the argument, however this wasn't a day that he was prepared to wait.

"I'll give you another 5 seconds..." Gary warned, knowing it was pointless. After five seconds he approached Ash who was laying on his side facing the wall, and grabbed him under his arms and set about pulling him off the bed. It was easy enough while Ash's legs still allowed him to be balanced on the bed, when suddenly only his feet remained Gary fell to the floor under Ash's weight. Gary would be lying if he said it didn't hurt somewhat, Ash was a fair bit heavier than he'd remembered. His own fault he guessed for either overestimating his own strength, or underestimating Ash's weight.

Ash hadn't been expecting Gary to do that, he pulled himself up off the smaller boy he'd been awkwardly and unintentionally laying on before giving a hand and helping him up also, "I'm up now... happy?" Ash asked.

Looking at Ash just in his boxers, it was obvious to Gary how much he'd underestimated Ash's weight. His round chubby stomach wasn't that easy to miss, it protruded slightly over the sides of his boxers, and his belly button appeared quite large and deep. "No, I'd forgotten how heavy you are!" carry commented.

"Or perhaps you're just not as strong as you thought" Ash retorted.

"Haha... perhaps not." Gary conceded, "But doesn't mean you're not heavy!" Gary remembered how skinny he and Ash were as kids, back when Ash never lacked for energy and didn't know the meaning of the word 'lazy'. When he hit his early teens however Ash got over many of the fussy food habits he'd had a child, and started eating more. Especially junk food and candy, between his 12 and 13th birthdays he went from being really quite thin, as chubby as he is now.

"What evs" Ash replied, passing off Gary's comments disbelievingly.
112.title: Found Gary trying to wake him...

choices: They go inside, and Oak is there
They go inside, and Oak had to take care of an emergency
1122.content:
"Hrr...come on." Ash was grunting as he was getting dressed.

Gary was sitting outside the door waiting for Ash "Everything good?"

"It's these jeans, they fit fine last week." Ash exclaimed.

"Maybe it's the fact that you're getting fat." Gary teased.

"It's called a growth spurt."

"It's called you're lazy, and you eat a lot." Gary said bluntly. "Need any help?"

"Sure."

Gary walked in and kneeled in front of Ash. "Suck it in."
Ash did so, and could feel how tight they were as Gary buttoned the jeans, and did up his belt. Ash looked down to see that his stomach looked bigger, mostly cause when he relaxed it, the pants pushed it up.

"There you go big boy." Gary said, giving Ash's belly a slight squeeze.

"Uh thanks, I guess." Ash replied.

The rest of the of the morning went with out conflict, ash put on his black shirt, which he tucked in which emphasized how big his stomach looked, which was something he didn't mind.

After putting on the blue vest, and hat, he and Gary went down stair. After putting his shoes on, ash grabbed a snack from the kitchen. And the two made their was to Professor Oak's laboratory.

"You know if you didn't eat so much, you wouldn't have that gut." Gary said as they put their bikes on the rack outside.

"Why, not like it matters to me if I'm chubby, or even fat." Ash said. "Besides to be honest, it feels kinda good."

"Really?" Gary asked incredulously.
1122.title: Ash's trousers are too tight.

choices: Wait for him to come back.
11222.content: Ash and Gary head off to the lab. When they get to the lab Professor Oak isn't there so the boys...
11222.title: They go inside, and Oak had to take care of an ...

choices: At home, preparing to start his Pokemon journey.
With Ash at a diner in Vermilion City.
Leaving Pallet Town on his pokemon journey.
12.content: Where does Gary's story start?
12.title: Gary Oak

125.content:
As of twenty minuets ago, he and Ash were now Pokemon trainers, Gary behind him as Pallet Town faded into the distance as he and Ash progressed further onto the route towards Viridian City. Thanks to Ash they had arrived late, thus were unable to receive the traditional starter Pokemon. Instead Ash had got a Pikachu, and Gary an Eevee. Gary was content with this eventuality, Eevee's numerous branches of evolution would give him extended options of advantage over rivals when the time comes. Initially Ash had been confidant of his electric Pokemon's superiority over a normal type, a few jolts of electricity had dampened that confidence. Eevee was far more placid and obedient than Pikachu, the electric mouse even refused his Pokeball. It didn't seem like the ideal first Pokemon for a new trainer to Gary, but he was sure it would tame in time.

After only about half an hour of walking Gary couldn't help but noticed that Ash was already breathing rather heavily, he guessed it wouldn't be long before Ash suggested they take a break. He knew Ash wasn't fit, but truly didn't expect him to tire to quickly, especially since they weren't actually walking that fast. If they continued at this pace they may not get to Viridian until it's dark.
125.title: Leaving Pallet Town on his pokemon journey.

choices: Gary declines, and Ash goes alone.
1252.content:
After a two-and-a-half hour walk from Pallet, Gary and Ash finally arrived in Viridian City, he'd visited the city many times growing up but somehow coming her as a Pokemon trainer with a real sense of independence it felt so much more impressive. Instantly, just how dull the city was went out his head and he noticed things he'd never seen before. The Pokemon Gym, the Pokemon Stadium, the entry-point to Victory Road.

"Come on Gary, we should battle now" Ash said pointing at a wide open space, the markings indicating that this was a designated battle-ring.

Clearly Ash was as impressed by all the Pokemon facilities as he was, he had mentioned a battle earlier but hadn't persisted, "Very well Ashy Boy"

The two took up positions opposite each other in the battle-ring, Garry through out his Pokeball for the first time, it felt good. Pikachu wasn't in a Pokeball, but he obediently entered the field.

"May the best trainer win" Gary said.

Ash nodded and took the opportunity to take the first move, "Pikachu thunderbolt attack"

It was predictable first move, Gary noticed Ash's surprise Pikachu that obeyed the command, "Eevee doge it and use tackle"

Eevee did so with tremendous speed, it caught an mobile Pikachu off guard, knocking it to the floor. The battle continued for another ten minutes, ultimately Ash lost because of the predictability of his attacks. He wasn't disheartened as Eevee didn't damage Pikachu to the point he was unconscious, and Gary wasn't showing off about his win, as he would have been. The adrenalin of battle had made Ash feel hungry despite already having had lunch, he could feel his stomach growling, the thin-bastard that Gary was Ash could imagine that he wouldn't be in favour. "Want to go and get a snack?" Ash asked.
1252.title: Arriving at Viridian

choices: That evening, camping out in the forest.
Go to try and challenge Vermillion gym.
12523.content:
"Sure Ashyboy, getting all pumped up for my first ever battle has left me feeling hungry" Gary replied.

"Alight, cool" Ash replied in surprise.

They headed over to the Vermillion Mall, Gary remembered seeing a food-court their a few months back, it wasn't a particularly long walk but that didn't stop Ash complaining every now and then. They sat down at a seat near the window that overlooked much of Vermilion City, it wasn't much to look at but Gary couldn't help but feel inspired. They both opted to have a milkshake, burger, fries and a muffin for after, though Gary had wanted medium, Ash ordered them both large. The food tasted great, Gary rarely had fast food but despite doubts at finishing a large, but to his surprise he finished it, and not that long after Ash himself. As Gary swalloed the last crumbs of his muffin, and finished off his chocolate milkshake he could feel his stomach ache slightly, a touch of indigestion. He place his hand on his bloated stomach and rubbed it to try and make himself feel a little better.

It didn't take long for Gary to feel better. Though having had lunch on route 1 and then and then another lunch here his stomach was felt very round and bloated. Gary couldn't help looking over the table at Ash's stomach, unlike his it didn't look particularly bloated, he suspected this wasn't an unusual amount of food for him, though also unlike his Ash's stomach wasn't flat. On the rare occasion that he'd seen Ash shirtless, he had seen how pudgy the boy who had been so skinny as a kid had got in recent years. Gary was sure Ash wasn't overweight, but he was certainly quite chubby - more so than Gary himself would ever like to be.
12523.title: Gary accepts.

choices: They meet up again weeks later in Celadon City, and Gary's gained weight.
125231.content:
There was not much to do in Vermillion after all, the Gym was closed and the Stadium required a minimum of three Pokemon to enter - besides, it was reasonable to presume experience was required before successfully performing in either. So despite the fact that he and Ash weren't planning on travelling with one another permanently, he and Ash had decided to leave for Pewter City for their first gym battle.

Despite the fact that it was still quite sunny, and incredibly warm, it was getting late. They had managed to get around midway through the Vermilion Forest before they thought it best to stop for the night. They laid out their sleeping bags on a soft patch of grass and ate dinner, which composed of snacks they had picked up before leaving Vermilion. Gary didn't feel happy about eating so many unhealthy snacks, but neither did he want to cook on a camp fire. The amount they had bought had been too much to put in their rucksacks, so Ash carried them in a shopping bag. He couldn't help but notice how fast Ash had eaten, so much so that he had to eat faster than he'd like just to he didn't miss out on the best stuff. They had finished all of the food they bought, no saving any for breakfast. For the second time that day Gary's stomach felt bloated, so much so that he found it uncomfortable to sit, especially in the warm weather.

"God.. I feel so full" Gary said to Ash, who was lying down lazily beside him.

"So do I" Ash replied as he rubbed his stomach slightly, "well a little bit"

"I'm gonna have to change for bed straight away" Gary said. With great sped he stood up, getting changed for bed in this weather basically constituted stripping down to his boxers. He had only got his two shoes off by the time Ash decided to do the same. It felt good to finally get his sticky shirt and trousers off, Gary packed his clothes back in his bag and lay down on top of his sleeping bag. Only now that he had his shirt on could he see just how bloated he was from all he had eaten that day, his stomach felt as round as a football, it was no wonder his trousers felt so uncomfortable.

"It's no wonder your podgy if you eat like that often" Gary said to Ash who was sitting down on his sleeping bag beside Gary, his stomach wasn't bloated but Gary could see a small amount of flab protruding over the front and sides of his boxers.

Ash took it as a joke and chuckled back, "you've eaten almost as much as I have to day" he pointed out, poking at Gary's rounded stomach. He had forgotten how toned Gary was, it was true that he was thin and not athletically built, but he still appeared visually fit with a four pack almost viable on his bloated chest.
125231.title: That evening, camping out in the forest.

choices: He had gained about ten pounds
He had gained about twenty pounds
1252312.content:
Gary had arrived in Celadon City in progress to obtain his 3rd gym badge from it's leader. Even the previous cities he'd visited hadn't prepared him for just how large Celadon City was. Never ending tower blocks littered the skyline, the city streets were constantly buzzing with floods of people. The city's Pokemon Centre was housed in one of the cities taller tower blocks, beyond a pokemon centre it contained all the amenities a Pokemon trainer could want, after just a cursory glance at the building map, Gary could see that there were shops, stadiums, rooms, cinemas and restaurants. He had taken a lift to the 23rd floor, on which there was a wide selection of shops and restaurants, the view of the city was magnificent, there was nothing quite like the view of a cityscape at night.

Before heading over to get a room for the night, he decided to get some dinner at the Pizza restaurant. After ordering he sat down at a table overlooking the city and waited for his order to arrive, he hadn't eaten anything since lunch time, which had just consisted of a new snacks he'd picked up, this was to be his first decent meal in a couple of a days. He could feel his stomach growl, and looked around as he was conscious of others hearing. The mouthwatering smell of other people's pizzas were just making him even more hungry.

After what felt like an hour, but was in fact only about ten to fifteen minutes, Gary's order arrived. A large margherita pizza and garlic bread with cheese. He smiled meekly as the waitress placed it on the table in front of him. The name was accurate, it was a larger pizza than he'd been expecting, in retrospect it might have been wise to order a medium or no garlic bread. But it was done now, and he wasn't about to let an expensive pizza go to waste.

With the exception of the pizza crust, Gary finished his entire dinner at record pace, the amount of walking, and lack of proper meals recently had definitely increased his appetite, he didn't feel as full as he'd expected - certainly not bloated. For afters he ordered a bowl of chocolate ice cream to finish off with, even though his teeth tingled as he ate it, he didn't slow.

After finishing the gargantuan meal, he settled the bill and headed up to see if there was room available for the night.

"I'm sorry sir, we don't have any small or standard rooms vacant for the night" the receptionist informed Gary as he stood waiting.

"Oh.." Gary replied in consideration. He wasn't sure what he would do, he couldn't afford to stay in anything bigger, it would probably be wise to see if there was a room elsewhere. "Never mind then... thanks anyway."

"Gary?.." a voice said from behind him as he moved away from the reception area.

Gary turned, it was Ash. "Ashy boy!" Gary said in a rarely enthused tone.

"You staying here" Ash asked.

"No... they're out of rooms" Gary explained, "you?"

"Yeah, I checked in when i first arrived just incase" Ash said.

It was unusually wise of Ash to do so, Gary was kicking himself that he hadn't also done the same.

"Wanna kip on my rooms sofa tonight?" Ash asked.

"Really? Gary answered quickly, "yes please"

Ash lead Gary down the corridor to his room, he was impressed by the room. Surprisingly large for a standard, with ensuite bathroom, wifi and satellite TV. Gary placed his bags on in the corner of the room besides the sofa.

"Not bad, for a standard room is it?" Ash said, placing himself heavily on his bed.

"No, it's great" Gary replied as he removed his hoodie and sat down on the sofa.

"Get ready for bed and we can watch a movie" Ash suggested, as he started pulling off his shirt and trousers and dived under the duvet.

Gary routed through his bag for a few moments before deciding to also sleep just in his boxers, taking longer to do so then Ash, he slowly removed his shoes and socks before removing his belt, unbuckling his trousers and pulling down placing them on the arm of the sofa, he next pulled off his shirt and stuffed into his bag, and brought up his sleeping bag and laid it over the sofa where he was to sleep. After he was changed he turned back around to face Ash who was flicking through the film list with the TV remote, after a few seconds Ash fixed his eyes on Gary's body.
1252312.title: They meet up again weeks later in Celadon City,...

choices: Next morning at breakfast, trying to forget about it.
Wake up and go to the gym before breakfast.
12523121.content:
"Woah!... looks like someone's put on weight!" Ash exclaimed tactlessly in amazement as he fixed his eyes at Gary's bare torso.

"Perhaps a few pounds" Gary replied as he meekly rubbed his stomach.

"Looks like way more than a few pounds" Ash insisted with a big grin on his face. Ash loved the irony, Gary had been very conscious about his fitness and avoiding fatty foods, while berating Ash, who eats like a pig, for his lack of exercise and all the junk food he ate. It had only been a few months since they'd last seen each other, back then Gary's body had been lean and toned, and Gary was proud of that fact. Now his belly had become very visibly pudgy.

Gary had realised for a while that he'd gained a bit of weight, he just didn't think it would be that noticeable. He was now regretting taking his shirt off, there by revealing it to Ash. After all when fully clothed he appeared as slender as ever.

"How did it happen?" Ash asked, a big grin still on his face "with you being such a health freak and all!"

Gary sat down softly on the sofa and sighed quietly, "it's difficult eat healthily on a Pokemon journey... which you'd know if you'd ever tried eating healthily!" a said, managing a tactful chuckle to assure it wasn't taken with offence, "plus the only exercise I have time for now is walking when on my travels."

"True enough..." Ash agreed, "though you must have eaten a hell of allot of junk food for your belly to go from flat to fat in less than a month".

Regretfully Ash was right, despite his brash manner. Gary had eaten far too much junk food meals and snacks the past few weeks, something he swore he'd never do. And why? Because it was easy and convenient, they saved time cooking, weren't expensive and gave him plenty of energy. All that had come with a price which he was only now realising the extent of. Even just sitting down he could feel his bare belly flab touching his lap as it protruded over the front of his boxers.

"It don't matter none" Ash said, "your now just a pudgy Pallet Town boy! Your no longer the only guy who's as thin as a stick."

Gary didn't know if Ash was joking, or if he was trying to be a comfort, yes it was true that he was thinner than any guy he knew from Pallet, but it was hardly much of a consolation. Anyway, he betted he was still thinner than most of them, he considered retorting with a comment about Ash being fatter than any of them, but he didn't particularly want to insult Ash, especially since as chubby as Ash was he was far from overweight, and didn't actually look especially fat providing his belly wasn't exposed.
12523121.title: He had gained about ten pounds

choices: Ignores it, and gets straight on the treadmill.
125231212.content:
Gary slept quite well, he drifted off halfway through the movie and awoke early morning. He tried getting back to sleep, but Ash's reaction to his slight weight gain was burned his mind, he felt that he should be doing something about it, rather than just sleeping.

After a half hour of tossing and turning, trying to return to sleep, Gary decided he'd get up and head over to the gym before breakfast. He slid quietly out of bed, and rustled in his rucksack looking for a shirt and his tracksuit bottoms, before he put them on he turned his back on the bed where Ash lay sleeping and pulled down his boxers and replaced them with a clean pair. Once he was fully dressed, he grabbed his hoodie, placed his wallet and Pokeballs in his small shoulder bag and headed for the door. He did consider leaving a note, but decided he would send a text to Ash once he was down their.

The Gym was nearer than he'd expected, a short walk to the lift from the room, followed by another short walk from the lift to the Gym. He paid his entry fee, stuffed his bag and phone into a locker and headed through to the gym. It was very empty, hardly surprising at 7:15 AM, he decided to warm himself up on the treadmill before moving forward to the weights. As he made his way to the treadmill he noticed a digital scale near an unmanned reception desk....
125231212.title: Wake up and go to the gym before breakfast.

choices: Exercises for about an hour until Ash turned up looking for him.
Exercises hard for a couple of hours and misses breakfast.
1252312122.content:
He tried to resist the urge, and even walked passed it, but in the end he decided that he had to know. He made a u-turn and headed back to the scales, as you'd expect in a gym they looked to be of good quality, and would thus give an accurate reading. He slipped off his shoes, placed his hoodie on the reception desk beside him and nervously stepped onto the scales.

The digital reading blinked informing him that it was calculating his weight, after 5 seconds it displayed it's figure: 149 pounds - 10.9 stone. He stepped backwards heavily, he could scarcely believe it. When he'd last weighed himself about a month back at home he'd been 9.13 stone, in such a short time he'd climbed a whole 11 pounds. And judging by the fact he'd done no real exercise beside walking, it was all fat. Everything Ash had said was true, he sighed heavily and climbed onto the treadmill, slightly dejected.

As he ran he could feel his stomach jiggling slightly, and he soon noticed that he was tiring quicker than normal, if he was going to become fit again he was going to have to exercise hard and at every opportunity he got.
1252312122.title: Decides to weigh himself.

12523121221.content:
"Gary" Ash said, he looked into the Gym and noticed Gary jogging slowly on a cross trainer, "Gary, it's breakfast time".

Gary looked to the side at Ash, and got off as soon as he'd slowed down. He'd gotten far less than he'd planned done, and now he was going to have breakfast, that surely wouldn't help.

"Trying to get rid of that?" Ash asked with a cheeky smile on his face as he prodded Gary's stomach.

"Trying to get in shape again" Gary rephrased.

"Yep, yep." Ash replied, "perhaps if I'd worked out after getting fat... I'd have been skinny again" Ash pondered to himself, looking blankly at a treadmill.

"Perhaps you would Ashyboy" Gary replied. "you still can..."

"D'you weigh yourself?" He asked, "how much?" deciding not to wait for an answer.

Gary paused for a second, and looked at the scale they were both standing beside "I did.... and ten stone nine" he revealed trying to sound unashamed.

"Wow.. With all that extra weight, it's no wonder your so pudgy" Ash replied.

Did Ash not know the meaning of tact? Or was he intentionally trying to tease him? Gary suspected it was a bit of both. "Let's see how much you weigh then" Gary said pushing Ash towards the scale and taking his bag from him.

"Eleven stone" Ash said unsurprised, "not that much more than you."

Gary pulled the bottom of Ash's shirt up to reveal his chubby belly, "Your right... though your still considerably fatter than me" he added.
12523121221.title: Exercises for about an hour until Ash turned up...

1253.content:
Gary was surprised, despite his earlier prediction Ash hadn't yet suggested they stop for a break. Even after a couple of hours walking he hadn't really started breathing any further heavily, a slight lack of confidence on Gary's part. They had decided to stop for a quick lunch before the final leg of the route, Gary reckoned they were now less than an hour off, and while not as hungry as knew Ash was, he could feel his own stomach growling, an uncomfortable sensation he wasn't use to.

They found a large clearing that was partially obscured from the sun, and sat down cross legged opposite one another. Lunch was nothing special, they'd both packed sandwiches and crisps. Gary knew this was to be his last home prepared food in a while, which couldn't help but make him feel homesick.
1253.title: Stopping for lunch

15.content:

15.title: More choices...

152.content:
Name Hilbert 'Toya' Black
Age: 20
Complexion: Fair
Hair: Brown
Height 5'10
Weight: 9 stone 9 lbs ---- 135 lbs
Body type: Skinny fat
Description: Hilbert Black, known to his friends as Toya, is a extroverted young Pokemon Trainer from Nuvema Town traveling with his friends Cheren and Bianca to face his first gym battle. His relaxed nature, that some call lazy, is much to the contrast to his two friends. And despite physically appearing to be quite slender, he has a surprisingly pudgy stomach, mostly on account of his lack of exercise, rather than bad eating habits.
Image http://tinyurl.com/bmjpu3x


Where does Hilbert start his story?

1. At home in Nuvema Town, preparing to collect his first pokemon with Cheren and Bianca.
2. In Accumula Town, coming across Team Plasma
3. At Striaton City, preparing for his first Gym Battle
152.title: Hilbert 'Toya' Black

1522.content:
"Did you hear that" Cheren said, flapping at Hilbert and Bianca to be silent.

"Hear what" Hilbert said, rather predictably.

"Shhh" Charen responded, giving Hilbert a gentle whack on his shoulder.

"It's coming from over there" Bianca pointed down a street, and started jogging in that direction.

"Hey wait up Bianca" Cheren shouted after her, before giving chase.

Hilbert sighed quietly to himself, before he opted to walk in the direction his two friends had gone. It only took a couple of minuets before he caught back up with them, as they had been stopped by the roadside as a crowd of people stood around watching something, from his angle Hilbert couldn't see.

"What's going on?" Hilbert asked Charon when he reached them.

"Not sure... he just finished speaking when I got here" Charon said pointing at an oldish looking man, flanked by two people in uniforms that looked to be grey tunics, infront of him was a intimidating looking women with red hear, she also wore a grey tunic style uniform, though the epaulets and clearly indicated her seniority.

"You are instructed to leave this street" a male voice said, stepping onto the scene. It was a police officer. "You are causing an disturbance"

"We're not under your jurisdiction officer" the women said coldly.

"I think you'll find that you are" the police officer signaled his back up which were approaching from the other side, "disperse now, or you will be detained."

"More up Charon, I cant see" Hilbert whispered, he pushed his way to the front, but tripped on the curb and landed awkwardly in the path of the red headed women.

"Toya, get out of there" Bianca shouted, she grabbed his hand and pulled him back on to the pavement before he could accidentally involve himself in the frakus.

"Step down officer" the red women demanded, "we won't..."

Her words were halted by the arrival of more police officers.
1522.title: Accumula Town

choices: Set up a sight to camp for the night.
15221.content:
The red women looked scornfully as they became overwhelmingly outnumbered, she turned and signaled her cohorts to withdraw down a dark alleyway. As expected, the police followed, but by the failure of any to return it didn't seem like they caught any of them. The police then turned their attention to the crowd that had gathered to watch the confrontation, Charen looked disappointed that he'd missed what it was all about, Bianca, like Gilbert didn't seem too bothered.

"Shall we go guys?" Bianca suggested.

"Might as well" Charen huffed.

"Don't worry, Charen, we'll no doubt find out what that was all about in no time." Gilbert said, trying to comfort him.

"Hmm" he started, before he noticed the warm smile on Gilbert's face, "I guess you're right"

"What shall we do now then" Gilbert asked, looking at Bianca.

"Is there a gym here?... " she pondered.

"No, there isn't. The nearest is Striaton City... north of here" Charen explained calmly.

"We're not gonna go there today,.. we've been walking for ages!" Gilbert commented.

"It's only been an hour or so" Charen said.

"Yeah, Man up Gilbert" Bianca added.

"Thank you for that Bianca" Gilbert rolled his eyes.
15221.title: The uniformed thugs leave.

152212.content:
"There's a park just down the end of this road, we may as well set camp there for the night" Charen suggested, to Hilberts relief.

"It's only just gone seven" Bianca protested.

"Yeah... time for some rest and some dinner" Hilbert said gleefully.

"We've gotta set up the camp sight first Toya" Charen pointed out.

They walked down the road, to the large town park, which was very quiate. The only people there were a few other pokemon trainers, and some people cutting through on their ways home from work. When Charen had said 'set up camp' it had been a slight exageration, the three had unpacked their sleeping bags and layed them on a flat area of grass infront of a large oak tree. They were no deliberating about what to do for dinner.

"If we hadn't set up our beds already we could have gone to a nice resturiont" Bianca pointed out.

"There was a couple of take outs in the road we passed" Charen recalled.

"That sounds fine for me" Hilbert said, as always a smile on his face.

"Who's gonna go" Charen asked.

"Me" Bianca quickly said.

"No need to be so quick Bianca, I wasn't goning to offer" Hilbert said, ammused by her quick reaction.

"Anything that means I don't have to sit down and do nothing for ages" she retored.

Hilber and Charen both dug in their pokets and passed her £5 notes, "thanks Bianca" Charen said.

"Yep thanks, Bianca" Hilbert added.
152212.title: Set up a sight to camp for the night.

1522121.content:
It had been over an hour since Bianca had gone, Hilberts stomach was growling so loudly that he was unable to prevent Charen from hearing. The two had lain down on their sleeping bags and chatted for the time.

"There she is" Hilbert said sitting up.

"What took you so long... you've were aages!" Charen asked.

"I saw a shop... then another shop" Bianca explained, "you know the story."

"Whatcha get" Hilbert asked.

She lifted three bags of fish and chips out of one of the carrier bag that she had, "I ate while I was waiting" she started, obviously building up to something.

"Already" Charen asked, "how come"

"Well there was this late night shopping at the mall down the road. I was going to go, but I thought I better get eats first." she explained.

"I see" Hilbert said.

"You guys can come if you want." She said half heartedly.

"Oh... very tempting!" Hilbert said sarcastically.

"No thanks Bianca"

"Thanks guys" She said, quickly dumping the three packs in front of them, and heading back in the direction they came.

"Means for food for us" Hilbert said opening up the the bags of fish and chips, and placing it front of he and Charen.

"True" Charen replied, "I doubt we'll finish it though. There's alot there"
1522121.title: Eventually comes back.

choices: it was almost as if she was purposefully fattening her son up...
maybe she met someone on the way back?
153.content:
Nate lets out a yawn, stretching as he woke up from his long slumber. Hopping out of bed, he gets dressed in his prefered clothing the boy was sleeping off his hard work from beating the Pokemon Leauge for the third time, the young man walked downstairs, seeing that his mother left him breakfast on the table. He walked over, noticing a note and picking it up, reading it.

Dear Nate,

I'm off to see a movie you starred in again~
I left you some food, I hope you stay a while,
I wanna talk to you when I come back!

Love,
Mom

"Aw, that's so nice nice of her!" Stated Nate, setting the note down and starting on breakfast.

He sat through a lot of it, letting out a short burp as his chubby belly protruded from his shirt. It was no big deal though, in his mind, he could just work it off. He did it before, he always has to be careful with his meals, he's sometimes too prone to gaining. However, it was his mom's day, so he decided to sit at home, relaxing on the couch as his mom returned home. Nate could see a big smile plastered on her face, as she brought in tons of groceries.

"Home already?" The purposefully lazy Nate remarked as his mother slammed the door shut behind her.

"Hehe, yes I am!" Said his mom, who gleefully placed the food down on the counter, something was off with her though...
153.title: Sounds Of Grumbling

1553322.title: More choices...

info.brief_description: The story about the pokemon journey of male trainers who gain weight along the way...
info.description:
The story about the pokemon journey of male trainers who gain weight along the way...

Rules
* Only males characters can gain;
* No sudden and unnatural gains - meaning no magic, weight gain formulae etc;
* More than one person may gain per story - other primary characters for example, but mainly keep to the chosen primary character;
* No vore.
* Sex allowed - male and female, only don't be too explicit.
* Primary pokemon trainers are from 16 to 18+, a fair bit older than in the anime (in part because of the previous rule, further explanation below)

 

Prelude:

As the young trainers of the Pokemon world come of age, they leave home in order to undertake the Pokemon league challenge, overcome the obstacles in their way and become the strongest that they can be.

League rules
* Entrants to the Pokemon League challenge must be at least aged 16 (in practice few are accepted until they are 18)
* Upon acceptance, trainers will be granted a starter-Pokemon by their local Pokemon League official
* To qualify for entry into the Pokemon Championship trainers must obtain at least 6 gym badges.

Orre League
The Orre Colosseum's, nicknamed the 'Orre League', are unaffiliated with the Pokemon League, and are a far tougher and brutal challenge. Though under license by the Orre government, the Colosseum are controlled and operated by the ruthless Cipher Syndicate.

Like the Pokemon League, Orre officials will provide entrants with starter-Pokemon. The challenge is less linear, trainers who achieve recognition in the Colosseum will be invited to Realgam Tower.


Regions

Kanto
         Capital: Celadon City
         League: Indigo League
         Climate: Temperate
         Syndicates: Team Rocket

Johto
         Capital: Goldenrod City
         League: Silver League
         Climate: Temperate
         Syndicates: Team Galactic

Hoenn
         Capital: Slateport City
         League: Ever Grande League
         Climate: Tropical
         Syndicates: Team Aqua, Team Magma

Sinnoh
         Capital: Jublife City
         League: Lily of the Valley League
         Climate: Temporate/Mountainous
         Syndicates: Team Galactic

Unova
         Capital: Castelia City
         League: Ventress League
         Climate: Temporate
         Syndicates: Team Plasma

Orre
         Capital: Phenac City and Realgam Tower
         League: Colosseum challenge (non-league)
         Climate: Desert
         Syndicates: Cipher Syndicate, Team Snagem
